There are many misconceptions about migration. @UNmigration explains 5 things you should know ⬇️ https://t.co/XMvhy7NT6S #ForMigration 

https://t.co/FVywwTNQM6

"Today’s pledges will help humanitarians across Yemen reach even more women, men and children who are in dire need." -- @antonioguterres on Tuesday as donors pledge US$2.6 billion for Yemen humanitarian operation. https://t.co/2pmGCZLSOI #InvestInHumanity https://t.co/lfq6AzLWez

Ready, set, takeoff! 🛫

Every day, more than 100 humanitarians and 11 metric tons of cargo arrive, depart or pass through Rumbek, South Sudan. More on @WFP_UNHAS' lifesaving work: https://t.co/iGwxuNTPmT  https://t.co/Lly5j1wOVC

"Journalism and the media are essential to peace, justice, sustainable development and human rights for all – and to the work of the United Nations" -- @antonioguterres tells journalists in Geneva. https://t.co/pohbMtWFXa https://t.co/uzViPHs9Hh
Have a look at our latest @instagram story to meet military & police officers from Nepal🇳🇵 #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping ➡️ https://t.co/UH4OQBPYqm https://t.co/0FM4mrUyZK
Storm-resistant homes & thousands of acres of mangroves are just a few of the ways a new @UNDP project is helping fortify Viet Nam against natural disasters. https://t.co/EQDjjx6tWT #ClimateAction

"All of us must do everything in our power to prevent and end sexual and gender-based violence in and around conflict, and to support victims and survivors." -- @antonioguterres at joint UN/@ICRC event on Monday. https://t.co/qo40zWd4Xp https://t.co/3Cw1AeV4PV

Ameen is just one of 3.3 million displaced people caught up in the world's largest humanitarian crisis. On Tuesday, @UNOCHA launches a major appeal to help the people of Yemen. https://t.co/HwaQHxAyA1 #InvestInHumanity https://t.co/mqirUNIjn9

"We need a new vision for arms control in the complex international security environment of today" -- @antonioguterres at Conference on Disarmament urging countries to seek security in diplomacy & dialogue, rather than weapons. https://t.co/MIZu7Cs1T5 https://t.co/864feuXK3E

"We wanted to show a hopeful future."

Congratulations to #BlackPanther's Hannah Beachler on a historic #Oscars win! The production designer, pictured here with Omotola J. Ekeinde, was at UNHQ last year for a special #AfricanDescent decade event. https://t.co/N78DVSyDiR https://t.co/MTtCGkQFm8

"The Human Rights Council is the epicentre for international dialogue & cooperation on the protection of all human rights -- civil, political, economic, social & cultural." -- @antonioguterres at Monday's @UN_HRC opening: https://t.co/CDAEPAQWHq https://t.co/gI3P3KDUkp

"We have focused on results, making the UN more responsive and respected."  - @antonioguterres on the launch of new reform initiatives, aimed at creating a more effective & efficient UN: https://t.co/ym7BwzBfzr https://t.co/EvqnRSHUUb
This week at UNHQ: @UN_PGA High-Level Debate on International Migration and Development https://t.co/EJnAYEgfns #ForMigration https://t.co/OQXrad7oVR
Continues this week @UNGeneva: Conference on Disarmament (through 29 March) with address from @antonioguterres. https://t.co/Ooq2Xn5nEs https://t.co/gmtTcNkUBW
On Monday at @UNGeneva: @antonioguterres to address opening of 40th session of the Human Rights Council. Follow @UN_HRC & see: https://t.co/MCFWHy2w7f #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/MhhQtLhyWM
What's happening this week at the UN? #InvestInHumanity Yemen Pledging Conference, #ZeroDiscrimination Day, #WorldWildlifeDay & much more: https://t.co/28eSBlR3gS https://t.co/6PSlj05L0e

A life without chocolate 🍫 ? 

In Ecuador, generations-old cocoa businesses are on verge of collapse as farmers don’t receive fair pay - but new @UNDP-supported blockchain-based tracker may save the industry. 

https://t.co/YKnSpoCoeR

It's #Oscar Sunday! 

Did you know that a UN-produced film won a 1947 Academy Award? See: https://t.co/P4rxTwPmaf https://t.co/sXD64JQh3S

Violence in Afghanistan claimed more than 3,800 civilian lives in 2018 - the highest number of civilian casualties in the past decade, says new @UNAMAnews & @UNHumanRights report: https://t.co/McVO6OnA0E https://t.co/cWhyZhIl3D

During @UNAUSA Global Engagement Summit, @antonioguterres took time for photos with young participants. 

"I feel inspired by your energy and by your engagement. Keep it up, because we need you more than ever," he told them. https://t.co/KVHPqDa8Jy https://t.co/1FlzjCHGX1

"Change is going to have to come." -- Actor & activist @AlecBaldwin and his wife Hilaria call for #ClimateAction. Find out what you can do to help protect our planet: https://t.co/zTkumwgS40 https://t.co/chOeaXWi8G

UN Peacekeepers from Nepal serve at great personal risk & under harsh conditions to help others. We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCoS6BZ   #ServingForPeace https://t.co/yjyGUgklCi
The Human Rights Council reviews the human rights records of all 193 UN member countries — the only process of this kind in existence. More on @UN_HRC: https://t.co/gpZHzcPi5x https://t.co/TseC8iDN2Z
Do you have a bold solution to achieve #ZeroHunger? Apply to the @WFPInnovation and @Cargill Global Innovation Challenge! Deadline is  28 February 👉 https://t.co/SWha3vWyId https://t.co/htcRgfZYWh

Together we have taken over 100,000 climate actions already. 

Climate change is a race we can win. Go to https://t.co/zTkumwgS40 and join people around the 🌎 in taking collective #ClimateAction. https://t.co/KRlrGVs3Z6

To help protect our planet, @UNenvironment & partners are harnessing the power of satellites 🛰 to restore precious ecosystems. #ClimateAction 

https://t.co/ybRDIUDmO5

🎧 Listen to Nadine Labaki, the 1st-ever Arab woman director nominated for an Oscar, talk about why it was her duty to tell the story of the Syrian refugee crisis in Lebanon in her movie Capernaum. https://t.co/QtufL2IpT6

This week, @antonioguterres welcomed many young visitors to @VisitUN Kids Day at UNHQ. The children explored the work of the UN through games, puzzles & quizzes. More about the Kids Tours here: https://t.co/S5ptESSN0i https://t.co/BSBM7iPhH1

For Mina Thapa from Nepal #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping in South Sudan means being able to fulfill her childhood dream of serving humanity. We thank her and her colleagues for their service and sacrifice. https://t.co/36Rfdb4ov6 https://t.co/pNKMtE8kxa
Go behind-the-scenes with @antonioguterres at this week's @UNAUSA Global Engagement Summit in our latest @instagram story https://t.co/u0wd26dcCr
Every two weeks, a language dies. Protecting #IndigenousLanguages is key for safeguarding traditional cultures https://t.co/EtMqnCnV9r #WeAreIndigenous

Record global greenhouse gas emissions are putting the world on a path toward unacceptable warming, with serious implications for Africa: https://t.co/vBAseptanH via @africarenewal #ClimateAction https://t.co/W6jRIcn7wv

The right food can change your life. 🥦🍅🍊🍌🥚

Here's what @WFP is doing in Ethiopia to improve nutrition for children & pregnant women. #GlobalGoals 

https://t.co/UZVOPs9fCs

UN Peacekeepers leave their families behind and travel to some of the most hostile environments on earth to help others. More on the brave men & women #ServingForPeace ➡️ https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z https://t.co/21km4JOFoV

In a  world where biodiversity is lost at an alarming rate, we can all take action:
🍊 Buy local
🌱 Buy seasonal
🥗 Diversify your diet

Find out more from @FAO: https://t.co/WbSh3uWrrJ #ZeroHunger

https://t.co/nfroWmKakx

"We need to demonstrate that the UN is standing up for people left behind and is connected to their needs, aspirations & everyday problems. And I believe the UN is delivering." -- @antonioguterres tells @UNAUSA Global Engagement Summit https://t.co/KVHPqDa8Jy https://t.co/0dR6xpcoMY

South Sudan: With more than half the population facing severe food insecurity, @WFP is going to great lengths to provide life-saving support to millions. https://t.co/2TSju4QJ1b #ZeroHunger

https://t.co/qFNxjtvp4C

Starting now: @UNAUSA Global Engagmenet Summit with @antonioguterres. Watch live ⬇️
https://t.co/ExjX5Ewjgp

In 2015, 193 countries adopted 17 #GlobalGoals which aim to end poverty, protect the planet and ensure prosperity for everyone. Get all the details here ➡ https://t.co/txyuVlFzUP https://t.co/tDoTT7dJ8D

HIV treatment is available and prevention is possible -- when you #KnowYourStatus. Take the @UNAIDS quiz at https://t.co/meO92JLJSZ and find out if you should get tested for HIV. https://t.co/91LxbWg7cO

.@UNESCO is celebrating #WorldHeritage success stories & exploring the extraordinary effort that has gone into protecting some of humanity's most treasured places: https://t.co/YUtB6Nyon8 https://t.co/ZcNbMFeORH

Do UN staff members have diplomatic immunity?

@VisitUN tour guide Xiuhan has the answer ⬇️ https://t.co/xxbgnV1lmO https://t.co/uccykLdEb3

Great #ClimateAction news: Together we have taken over 100,000 climate actions. Keep logging your daily actions at https://t.co/zTkumwytsA and invite your friends to do the same to help tackle climate change. https://t.co/CwmKFPILgl
After conclusion of public hearings on Thursday, @CIJ_ICJ begins deliberations in Jadhav case (India vs Pakistan). https://t.co/oHr17WTDIG https://t.co/9h2tU8KTQL

The voices of the peoples in Non-Self-Governing Territories should be heard, @antonioguterres appealed during opening of 2019 session of Special Committee on Decolonization. Read full statement here: https://t.co/Yep8P2gE3u https://t.co/xz7Nu8mJWS

There are currently over 25 million refugees around the world. How does @refugees help them? 

⛺️ Shelter
💧 Water
🍚 Food
🚑Health care
and more: https://t.co/FDeHjoq4wJ

https://t.co/5dNe6A9S4s

More than half of the world’s languages could become extinct by 2100. But cultural and linguistic diversity are 🔑 for sustainable societies. More from @UNESCO on Thursday's #MotherLanguageDay: https://t.co/8DyBnfibet https://t.co/sms6A3L2Zd

Nepal provides 5700+ military and police officers to @UNPeacekeeping. We thank these brave men & women for their service and sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z  #ServingForPeace https://t.co/Czo2uwZ8vb
Wednesday was @VisitUN Kids Day at UNHQ in NYC. See what happened in our behind-the-scenes @Instagram story ➡️ https://t.co/ZI0WSQxlYv https://t.co/BHOPhoXbYx
Good news for people & planet: @GCF_News is now working on US$2 billion worth of #ClimateAction projects with countries around the world. https://t.co/eWS4dqdFAu https://t.co/6EgFqRPrLj

On Thursday's #MotherLanguageDay & every day, the UN tweets in many languages:

Arabic @UNarabic
French @ONU_fr
Hindi @UNinHindi
Kiswahili @UmojaWaMataifa
Portuguese @NacoesUnidas
Russian @UnitedNationsRU
Spanish @ONU_es https://t.co/s1SHtmGWNB

When a language disappears, it takes with it an entire cultural & intellectual heritage. On Thursday's #MotherLanguageDay, @UNESCO stresses the importance of the preservation of #IndigenousLanguages. https://t.co/8DyBnfibet https://t.co/TldWSHXZ3p

Wednesday was @VisitUN Kids Day at UNHQ. Young visitors explored the work of the UN through games & quizzes and got to meet @antonioguterres, the UN Fire Department and our K9 🐶 colleagues. https://t.co/S5ptESBc8K https://t.co/uthZ48tUnK
Countries are spending more on health, but people are still paying too much out of their own pockets. Find out more from @WHO: https://t.co/nfJWGHr7Ln #HealthForAll https://t.co/jYzuvJM65S

Investing in youth is critical to achieving inclusive, equitable & sustainable development for present & future generations. New @UNDESA report shows how #Youth2030 can change the world: https://t.co/2GQRdF2GUz #GlobalGoals https://t.co/Efpk1Cki3F
For 100 years, @ILO has worked to achieve social justice and decent work for all. Find out more on Wednesday's #SocialJusticeDay: https://t.co/GxTaV7q6T8  #ILO100 https://t.co/OskmVf6GkH

Noura, a displaced Syrian girl, describes the difficult conditions inside Rukban makeshift settlement. Here is what @Refugees is doing to help: https://t.co/Z3lep3hp0K

https://t.co/yWW3I9OBcJ

"It was an opportunity to build strong, viable and sustainable communities" - Gideon from Ghana how it feels to make a difference with @UNVolunteers in South Sudan. https://t.co/y9WPbZeBXk https://t.co/bvg3i7R989
If you want peace and development, work for social justice - that's the theme of Wednesday's #SocialJusticeDay. https://t.co/CCZAy5f50x https://t.co/Mo1P1hLZzv
Why are some indifferent, even numb, in the face of mass suffering? This social scientist explained at a recent #TEDxKakumaCamp talk: https://t.co/ItLYNifWnu via @refugees https://t.co/mkU9vcR1Ns
Yemen: If collective peace efforts fail, cost of war will rise steeply at expense of the people, @OSE_Yemen tells Security Council on Tuesday: https://t.co/g0V4pXg4Dl

Social justice is only possible when all the barriers people face based on gender, race, ethnicity, religion, culture or disability are removed. More on Wednesday's #SocialJusticeDay: https://t.co/CCZAy5wGp7 https://t.co/ci2tE4PInY

Measles is one of the most contagious diseases, but it is preventable. Getting vaccinated is the best way to protect yourself and your community. https://t.co/UKkKD7Ia0i #VaccinesWork

https://t.co/8yJJfEwGTW

Work is a source of dignity! For 100 years, @ILO has promoted decent work, improving the lives of millions of people around the world 🌎 https://t.co/88yaWO8Bqd  #ILO100 

https://t.co/pN3GKoCeUf

1-year-old Roma Mohammad suffers from malnutrition, but thanks to a @WFP treatment programme in Yemen, her condition is improving. In 2019, WFP aims to help 3 million women & children in the country. https://t.co/I7OY52z5cq #ZeroHunger https://t.co/OboRAzYTnS

The Katowice Climate Package was adopted at #COP24 in December to make the #ParisAgreement implementation on #ClimateAction work for everyone. Details from @UNFCCC: https://t.co/mVnEpTugoK https://t.co/Wo74DgFoEP

Not all heroes wear capes! Make a nomination today for @Refugees' #NansenAward - and celebrate those who've given so much to help millions of people on the move worldwide. https://t.co/5DlQhSOmfS #WithRefugees https://t.co/Rea3Iqclde

From isolated area to thriving community.

Thanks to the IKEA Foundation, this refugee-hosting community in Ethiopia has been transformed https://t.co/CqyiSowF8B via @refugees #WithRefugees https://t.co/UV125sPlgL

What's the difference between a refugee and a migrant? 

Refugees are forced to flee their country escaping conflict, violence or persecution. More details from @refugees ⬇️

 https://t.co/vOgPaGkfwa
Members of the UN Security Council visited West Africa, where they reviewed peacebuilding progress in Côte d'Ivoire and Guinea-Bissau. https://t.co/QDX5PlxdPG https://t.co/6rFDE4K1Bq

Women around the 🌎 are leading #ClimateAction projects. 👩🏻👩🏼👩🏽👩🏾👩🏿Submit your woman-led project to be considered for a UN award & get recognized at #COP25 in Chile: https://t.co/eTUAGejTTG via @Momentum_UNFCCC https://t.co/uW71Yl0Vi3
Starts this week @UNGeneva: Committee on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights (through 8 March): https://t.co/Ef89DW7zLJ https://t.co/mn8cGBG3UZ
Starts this week @UNGeneva: Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination against Women (through 8 March). Documents, reports & more:  https://t.co/kmX99PP349 https://t.co/Z3kaOAwQSb
What's happening this week at the UN? #SocialJusticeDay, Mother Language Day highlights on #IndigenousLanguages & much more  >> https://t.co/28eSBlzspk https://t.co/6jaFOoxbxJ

Are you ready to tackle the world's biggest challenge?

@unenvironment is seeking inspired young problem-solvers with bold ideas for a greener future. To become one of the 2019 #YoungChamps apply here: https://t.co/iZjJJbvceA https://t.co/9aEpBjgPvo

From improving workplace safety to tackling forced labour -- see how @ilo has helped the 60 million workers in the garment industry worldwide, 80% of which are women ➡️ https://t.co/DLWoMluSWZ #ILO100 https://t.co/aDf3SYxwJ6

Ending violence against women & girls in the Sahel is crucial for achieving #GlobalGoals, says @AminaJMohammed following visit to the region. More in the latest @africarenewal: https://t.co/mFnzxmV848 https://t.co/VDBOUiqUxg

"The true test of reform will be measured in tangible results in the lives of the people we serve – and the trust of those who support our work.” – @antonioguterres on UN Reform. https://t.co/ym7BwzSQqZ https://t.co/OKwTHDuSWh

Measles is one of the 🌏’s most contagious diseases. Yet, thanks to the safe & cost-effective measles vaccine, millions of lives have been saved. More from @WHO ➡️ https://t.co/UKkKD7Ia0i #VaccinesWork https://t.co/USyBxCbfjL

"There is a USD 24 trillion economic upside for the world in making the #ParisAgreement a reality." --  @GlobalCompact's @Lise_Kingo on why #ClimateAction makes business sense. https://t.co/pVhRuOUqPi https://t.co/3xBOXHgf4o

Poor working conditions - with millions of people forced to accept bad work settings - are main global employment challenge, says new @ILO report: https://t.co/QC84ofmUva  #DecentWork https://t.co/7OrztzQeQ3

UN Peacekeepers come from different countries, cultures & backgrounds --
but share a common purpose to protect the most vulnerable. https://t.co/lZYeCoS6BZ #ServingForPeace https://t.co/K84N0Ep8UC

The @UNAOC fellowship aims at breaking down stereotypes & encouraging dialogue between cultures. This year's theme focuses on the role of women in peace & conflict prevention. Apply now: https://t.co/ARvYjKzQ3Y https://t.co/5HRzThoTo1

.@antonioguterres' strategy on new technologies aims to help make technology work for the benefit of all, reduce inequalities & achieve #GlobalGoals ➡️ More from @_UNChronicle https://t.co/tICr0KW0Bd https://t.co/E92EFY2k2v

The flag of the Republic of North Macedonia takes its place next to the flag of Nigeria outside UNHQ in NYC after the Prespa Agreement settled the name of the country this week. https://t.co/Im5MkYbFlT https://t.co/gVlDcI1XPB

When it comes to HIV, discrimination remains a major barrier for people seeking prevention services, HIV testing, treatment & care. 

Everyone has the right to health. 
https://t.co/TRAmUBLLTv #StandUp4HumanRights via @WHO https://t.co/QJQFPNzCwM
Mali: Ending violence & protecting civilian population will require an effective military response, says @UNHumanRights expert. https://t.co/ER22s6E5Ve #StandUp4HumanRights

Violence has been ongoing in NE Nigeria since the Boko Haram insurgency erupted in 2009. 2.5+ million people have been forced from their homes. 
Here's how @refugees is working to help: https://t.co/Dhidb2cbHc #WithRefugees https://t.co/8BaXLmhwub

More than 120 countries provide military & police officers to @UNPeacekeeping. 
Peacekeepers serve at great personal risk & under harsh conditions to help others. https://t.co/lZYeCoS6BZ #ServingForPeace https://t.co/1dae5ruQUe

Members of the UN Security Council visited Côte d’Ivoire and Guinea-Bissau this week. @UNDPPA explains how the Security Council travels and how these visits are organized: https://t.co/eeUMe6lTUb https://t.co/97q4XeHEqo

Leaders have a responsibility to their populations to pave the way toward peace, stability & reconciliation. -- @antonioguterres at opening session of UN Palestinian Rights Committee: https://t.co/fn9eMJeTgm https://t.co/3BRq9QBsGG

.@UNinSyria & @SYRedCrescent have completed delivery of assistance to 40,000+ mainly women in children seeking shelter in makeshift camp in Rukban. https://t.co/8jM9ifD11D via @OCHA_Syria https://t.co/WUoMLnhdV3

Cancer is a leading cause of death for children worldwide. On Friday's #InternationalChildhoodCancerDay learn what @who is doing to address inequalities when it comes to diagnosing & treating child cancer: ➡️ https://t.co/INIhIx9Rcc https://t.co/644gvWfcBY

Over 2,000 children were registered as "stateless" in Europe last year - leaving them essentially "invisible". @refugees & @unicef are calling for urgent action to ensure all children can say: #iBelong. https://t.co/QLj5y5TxA3 https://t.co/Cfnxp02jeA

"While reform is inherently about processes, the transformation that we seek is fundamentally about people," -- @AminaJMohammed about the importance of UN reform. https://t.co/ym7BwzBfzr #GlobalGoals 

 https://t.co/OUINQqmj7a

#FBF to a snowy view of UNHQ in 1996. 

Every day representatives from around the 🌍 gather here to find common ground on global challenges & take action on issues that cannot be resolved by any one country alone. https://t.co/FaoWoGzAzA https://t.co/On4caqeZHK

Yemen remains the world's worst humanitarian crisis, with 80% of the population – 24 million people – requiring some form of assistance. @UNOCHA is trying to meet their needs: https://t.co/fp2lVllkuI #InvestInHumanity https://t.co/rMJGW57bfN

How to be a champion for gender equality & break up with toxic behaviour: 
1) Defy stereotypes
2) Talk the talk
3) Disrupt culture of toxic masculinity
4) Share the care
5) Don't stand for intolerance

via @un_women. #GlobalGoals https://t.co/gSA0jUBXEW

The majority of migrants live & work legally, contributing to both their home & host countries, and spending 85% of their earnings in their host communities. More on the benefits of safe & orderly migration here: https://t.co/DI4BEQUY9G #ForMigration https://t.co/muMj28Ubv2

A quality education helps people understand the importance of safeguarding the planet, appreciate diversity & resist intolerance -- @AminaJMohammed on why education is key to achieving the #GlobalGoals https://t.co/NBGz812l7V https://t.co/myamjrAude
